topic: Designing Spaced Repetition Inside a Quiz System: Algorithms and UX
target_audience: product designers and teachers building practice schedules

refs.content: Spaced practice outperforms massed; optimal gap scales with desired retention interval.
Classic SRS algorithm underpinning many systems; defines ease factor, interval growth, and quality responses.
Engineering/UX considerations: leeches, over‑review, tagging; practical advice for maintaining large decks.

special_instructions: Compare fixed‑interval vs. SRS; give ergonomics (daily caps, lapses), tagging, and rematerialization of ‘leeches’ into targeted quizzes.
